definition: motionless; without movement.
example: Come over here and stand still.

definition: even; yet (used to emphasize a comparison).
example: These apples are very nice, but the others are better still.

definition: nevertheless; even so (used to introduce a contrasting idea).
example: My arm's very sore after the accident. Still, it feels better than it did yesterday.
persian: با این حال، با وجود این

definition: secretly revealed information before the official time.
example: The contents of the report have already been leaked to the press.

definition: arriving in large numbers (figurative).
example: Thousands of refugees are now flooding across the border.

definition: subject to intense scrutiny or investigation (figurative).
example: The Trade Secretary could find herself under the microscope.

definition: a friend I have known for a long time.
example: She's an old friend.

definition: wasn't able to catch the bus.
example: I missed the bus.

definition: it's very unlikely he'll come.
example: It's highly unlikely he'll come.

definition: very heavy rain.
example: Last night we had torrential rainfall.

definition: continuous attention/looking after.
example: His mother is very elderly and needs constant care.

definition: combine our assets/effort.
example: If we work together on this, we'll be able to pool our resources.
persian: منابع خود را روی هم ریختن

definition: end an inability to agree or move forward.
example: Do you think they'll be able to break the deadlock?

definition: a tiny amount compared to what is needed.
example: It may seem a lot of money, but really it's just a drop in the ocean.

definition: no negative consequence if you fail.
example: She might as well apply for the job; she's got nothing to lose.
persian: چیزی برای از دست دادن نداشتن

definition: a result that is obvious before it happens.
example: They're bound to win; it's a foregone conclusion.

definition: most importantly.
example: First and foremost, we must decide what to do.

definition: become worse. deterioration N.
example: (No sentence provided in glossary entry)

definition: the process of asking sb a lot of questions, especially in an aggressive way. interrogate sb v.
example: (No sentence provided in glossary entry)

definition: make sb make a mistake which shows they have been lying.
example: (No sentence provided in glossary entry)
persian: مچ کسی را گرفتن، به دام انداختن

definition: feeling ashamed because you have lost the respect of other people. humiliate sb v. humiliation N.
example: (No sentence provided in glossary entry)

definition: obviously.
example: (No sentence provided in glossary entry)

definition: relating to the treatment of illness (adjective form of THERAPY).
example: Most people find the treatment very therapeutic.

definition: examine carefully (verb form of SCRUTINY).
example: They are sure to scrutinize the results carefully.

definition: intended to cause argument or reaction (adjective form of PROVOKE).
example: His behaviour was very provocative.

definition: the state of being unknown to most people (noun form of ANONYMOUS).
example: Some people prefer to maintain their anonymity.

definition: having the same, or nearly the same, meaning. synonym N.
example: A Are the words phase and stage synonymous?

definition: the meaning of a word or phrase.
example: B In one sense, they're interchangeable.

definition: if two things are interchangeable you can use one instead of the other and the effect will be the same.
example: B In one sense, they're interchangeable.

definition: not clear: able to be explained in different ways. ambiguity N.
example: A It's a bit ambiguous to say 'She's a good student', isn't it?

definition: decide that sth has a particular meaning. interpretation N.
example: B Yes, you can interpret it in different ways.

definition: (of language) easy to understand. OPP opaque.
example: A The meaning of wrapping paper is transparent, isn't it?

definition: easy to understand and not needing more explanation.
example: B Yes, it's self-explanatory - just paper for wrapping presents and stuff.

definition: clear and accurate. SYN exact. precision N.
example: A Can you give me a more precise definition of soul?

definition: almost; very nearly (virtually the same/impossible/certain).
example: B Well, it's virtually the same as spirit - the part of you that is believed to exist after you die.

definition: the use of words to say the opposite of what you mean, often humorously (a trace/hint of irony = a little irony).
example: 'Thank you, Sam,' she said, with heavy irony.

definition: adjective form of irony.
example: In fact, Sam had hardly helped at all.

definition: the use of words to say the opposite of what you mean in order to be unpleasant to sb or make fun of sb.
example: 'Oh, that's just great,' was her sarcastic reply.

definition: adjective form of sarcasm.
example: 'Oh, that's just great,' was her sarcastic reply.

definition: (of words) not used with their literal (= usual) meaning.
example: Slim is used figuratively in the sentence Many firms are slimmer than they were.

definition: used of the kind of language you find in stories and poems.
example: Heart can be used in a literary way, e.g. She put her hand on her heart.

definition: (often used in dictionaries) showing that sth is bad or wrong.
example: The dictionary marks stupid as 'disapproving'.

definition: no longer modern or fashionable. SYN dated. OPP in current use.
example: Spiffing means 'great', but it's very old-fashioned.

definition: very informal words which are not suitable in formal situations.
example: In slang, wicked means 'very good'.

definition: FML expressing disapproval or criticism. SYN derogatory.
example: His pejorative comments about my essay upset me.

definition: rude or offensive (deliberately/highly insulting). insult sb v
example: He called Mark an 'old woman': how insulting!

definition: make jokes about them in an unkind way.
example: Stop making fun of her!

definition: make jokes about them in an unkind way.
example: (Definition entry only)

definition: make fun of them, often by copying what they say or do.
example: He's always mocking her country accent.
persian: تمسخر کردن، تقلید کردن برای ریشخند

definition: (of a vehicle) move very slowly.
example: As I crawled along the motorway...

definition: start having doubts about a decision you have made.
example: I was having second thoughts about staying with Marcus.

word: be in two minds about sth
definition: be unable to decide what to do about sth.
example: I'd been in two minds about going in the first place...

definition: kind (of sb).
example: but it was sweet of him to invite me...

definition: be busy and unable to do other things.
example: I wasn't tied up, so I said, 'Yes.'

definition: If sth dawns on you, you begin to realize it for the first time.
example: But now it dawned on me that he may have had an ulterior motive:

definition: a reason for doing sth that you keep hidden.
example: he may have had an ulterior motive:

definition: INF stupid.
example: How could I be so thick?

word: be the last thing on sb's mind
definition: be the thing that sb is least likely to be thinking about.
example: a romantic relationship was the last thing on my mind.

definition: avoid doing sth.
example: How can I get out of this, I wondered?
persian: قسر در رفتن، از زیر کاری در رفتن

definition: make sth/sb move quickly and without control.
example: something went into the back of me and sent the car flying off the road.
persian: به هوا پرتاب کردن، پرت کردن

definition: used to introduce surprising and often unwelcome news (gonna INF = going to).
example: Listen, you're not gonna believe this, but...

definition: make or persuade sb/sth to do sth.
example: I finally got the car to start. / I couldn't get him to leave the party.

definition: remain fresh.
example: We must eat the grapes - they won't keep.

definition: be enough for sb until a later time.
example: That will keep me going until lunchtime.

definition: say or write sth in a particular way.
example: It's hard to put your feelings into words.

definition: make sb work harder.
example: Some parents push their kids really hard. / I need to push myself more at work.
persian: فشار آوردن، تشویق به تلاش بیشتر کردن

definition: allow sb to take care of sth.
example: I'll leave that to you. / Leave it to/with me - I'll do it.
persian: سپردن کاری به کسی، واگذار کردن

definition: think or calculate sth to be a particular time or number.
example: What time do you make it? / I make that 25 now.
persian: محاسبه کردن، تخمین زدن (زمان یا عدد)

definition: cause sb to reach a particular condition or place.
example: It was the war that brought him to power. / What brings you here?

definition: be sold or produced with a particular feature.
example: I'm sure the radio comes with batteries.

definition: be sold or produced in different variations (colours, sizes, etc).
example: The chairs come in four different colours.
persian: در دسترس بودن در (رنگ یا اندازه)

definition: be enough or be acceptable in a particular situation.
example: Will that do? / Will these shoes do for the wedding?

definition: an official document that shows you are qualified to drive.
example: (Table entry)

definition: an official document showing when and where you were born.
example: (Table entry)

definition: a part for a car or machine to replace an old or broken part.
example: (Table entry)

definition: a person walking past a place by chance.
example: (Table entry)

definition: a short holiday from Friday to Sunday, or Saturday to Monday.
example: (Table entry)

definition: the number of years that a person is likely to live.
example: (Table entry)

definition: a path or route that is quicker than the normal way.
example: (Table entry)

definition: clothes that you wear to a party to make you appear a different character.
example: (Table entry)

definition: a short and usually very old song or poem for young children.
example: (Table entry)

definition: a machine into which you put money in the hope of winning more back.
example: (Table entry)

definition: your closest living relative (often used on official documents).
example: (Table entry)

definition: happening at the last possible moment.
example: It was a last-minute decision, but we managed to get a cheap holiday in Spain.

definition: A built-up area has a lot of houses and not many open spaces.
example: The area's quite built-up, but the beach is lovely.

definition: extremely anxious about sth.
example: My cousin is very absent-minded. He leaves things lying around and then gets panic-stricken when he can't find them.

definition: not easily upset by unkind or critical comments.
example: My brother's pretty thick-skinned, whereas I'm more sensitive.

definition: (of behaviour) irritating or unattractive.
example: I find this very off-putting and it makes me a bit tongue-tied.

definition: unable to speak easily because of nerves or shyness.
example: it makes me a bit tongue-tied.
persian: زبانم بند آمده، قادر به سخن گفتن نبودن

definition: (of a thing) no longer useful because it has been used so much.
example: These boots are worn out now, but they've been incredibly hard-wearing.

definition: (of a person) exhausted from work or exercise.
example: (Definition entry only)

definition: (of a product) remaining in good condition for a long time.
example: but they've been incredibly hard-wearing.

definition: (especially of sth unpleasant) seeming to last for ever.
example: the rows seem to be never-ending.

definition: often angry and easily annoyed.
example: It makes me very bad-tempered.

definition: not willing to listen to the ideas and opinions of others, SYN bigoted. OPPS broad-minded, open-minded.
example: My uncle's very narrow-minded:

definition: forgetful.
example: My cousin is very absent-minded.

definition: thinking in a concentrated way about sth and determined to achieve it.
example: (Definition entry only)

definition: a disappointment. let sb down v.
example: The course has been a real let-down.

definition: leave school, college, a course, etc. without finishing your studies. dropout N.
example: Some people have dropped out already.

definition: the number of people who attend an event. turn out v.
example: last night the turnout was awful.

definition: large changes made in an organization to improve it. shake sth up v.
example: There could be quite a shake-up at the end of the year.

definition: (of a vehicle or machine) stop working. breakdown N.
example: A car broke down on the side of the road and a lorry crashed into it;

definition: delay sth/sb. hold-up N.
example: we were held up in the ensuing tailback.

definition: a long line of traffic, moving very slowly. tail back v.
example: we were held up in the ensuing tailback.

definition: a vehicle that is so badly damaged that it is not worth repairing. write sth off v.
example: but the car was a write-off.
persian: اسقاطی، چیزی که ارزش تعمیر ندارد

definition: the ending of a relationship or association. break up v.
example: The break-up of their marriage was a real setback for Paula...

definition: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes a situation worse for sb. set sth/sb back v.
example: The break-up of their marriage was a real setback for Paula...

definition: the start of something bad (e.g. war, disease).
example: The outbreak of war followed.

definition: the amount of money spent.
example: What was the initial outlay?

definition: INF spend (money).
example: Did he lay out much money?

definition: made it start burning.
example: Two boys set fire to the school.

definition: start to burn.
example: These buildings catch fire easily.

definition: the fire started.
example: The fire broke out in the kitchen.

definition: burning.
example: The building is on fire.

definition: the fire moved and covered a larger area.
example: The fire spread to the first floor.

definition: suddenly began burning strongly.
example: The plane burst into flames.

definition: was destroyed by fire.
example: The cottage went up in flames.
persian: سوختن و نابود شدن در آتش

definition: the fire/flames became weak.
example: The fire/flames soon died down.

definition: stop the fire burning. SYN extinguish the fire FML.
example: They managed to put out the fire.

definition: fires that occur in forests during hot summer months.
example: We get a lot of forest fires here.

definition: started a fire for a purpose (e.g. in a fireplace or garden).
example: I lit a fire this morning.

definition: the fire stopped burning.
example: The fire went out last night.

definition: suddenly the lights stopped working.
example: Suddenly the lights went out.

definition: stop something from burning.
example: Put that cigarette out, please.

definition: an argument/conflict started.
example: A fight broke out between the gangs.

definition: suddenly started crying.
example: The little girl burst into tears.
persian: بنای گریه گذاشتن، ناگهان گریه کردن

definition: the noise became weaker.
example: The noise soon died down.

definition: very heavy rain.
example: We had torrential rain last night.

definition: very strong winds.
example: They are predicting gale-force winds tonight.

definition: a lot of difficulty. SYN great difficulty.
example: I had considerable difficulty getting here.

definition: a lot of damage. SYN widespread damage.
example: The storms caused extensive damage.

definition: a very noticeable accent. OPP slight accent.
example: He speaks with a strong accent.

definition: an action or occasion that creates a feeling of pride.
example: It was a great honour to meet the president.

definition: a big effort. SYNS special/concerted effort.
example: We made a real effort to finish it on time.

definition: biggest worry. SYN principal concern (also growing concern = an increasing concern).
example: My main concern is the effect of the drugs.

definition: a person who you recognize and know.
example: It's nice to see a familiar face.

definition: a short statement giving the main points of sth.
example: Could you give us a brief summary?

definition: a very typical example of sth. SYN perfect example.
example: It was a classic example of his stupidity.

definition: a lot of disapproval from others. SYN fierce criticism (also widespread criticism).
example: I had to face strong criticism over this issue.

definition: a state of complete confusion. SYN total chaos.
example: The place was in utter chaos when I arrived.

definition: they were lucky to get away safely.
example: The children had a narrow escape.
persian: نجات یافتن به سختی، قسر در رفتن

definition: a building or object that is very unpleasant to look at.
example: neighbour Adam Clark thought it was a real eyesore,

definition: show you are angry or upset about sth, or feeling insulted by it.
example: Mr Hunt took offence and made it clear that he would do no such thing.

definition: say sth to make sb understand a situation.
example: and made it clear that he would do no such thing.

definition: refuse to do the thing you have been asked to do.
example: made it clear that he would do no such thing.

definition: successfully arrive at an agreement (reach a conclusion/compromise/verdict).
example: One year on, the two men still haven't reached agreement.

definition: recognize the possibility that sth may happen.
example: and now face the prospect of having to settle their dispute in court.

definition: end an argument between people (settle an argument).
example: having to settle their dispute in court.

definition: think that sb should be blamed for sth.
example: He holds me entirely responsible and refuses to take any of the blame.

definition: accept responsibility for sth.
example: and refuses to take any of the blame.

definition: arrive at a time or stage at which sth happens.
example: we've reached the point where neither of us will back down.

definition: stop asking for sth, or stop saying you will do sth.
example: we've reached the point where neither of us will back down.

definition: completely.
example: He holds me entirely responsible.

definition: completely different.
example: entirely different

definition: agree completely.
example: agree entirely

definition: not completely (used to soften speech).
example: I'm not entirely sure/happy/satisfied.
